title: Question:
author: inthelongrun
content: So after failing to secure a fight with light-heavyweight IBF, WBC, WBO, and lineal champion Artur Beterbiev, the WBA champion Dmitry Bivol will have a mandatory defense of his belt against the undefeated and former super-middleweight champion Gilberto "Zurdo" Ramirez. The fight will be on November 5 in the United Arab Emirates. At least the fight is happening on a neutral ground. Expect Bivol to become the betting odds favorite but most likely not that wide over the gutsy Ramirez. Both are undefeated and well experienced against top-caliber fighters but someone's 0 gotta go. It is known that Canelo Alvarez who is fighting GGG next still has a rematch clause on Bivol which might be activated next year. Boxing record:Dmitry Bivol 20-0-11 KOsZurdo Ramirez 44-0-30 KOs

comments.author: dothebeats
comments.body: It's just a match IMO. Both fighters are great in their own accord and this bout may even last up to 12 rounds. Bivol has the stamina and footwork advantage but both are power punchers too, so it's only a matter of who's going to connect that punch first to get the win. Ramirez has the reach advantage too, so it's quite easier for him to land some punches and get some points if they managed to drag this until decision. Bivol is the heavy favorite but I am not discounting Ramirez's creds though.

I understand you maybe be a fan of Dmitry Bivol but try to check the record of the two fighters to see the most experience fighter and how they both performed when they face the same opponent which is Sullivan Barrera.In my opinion, Zurdo Ramirez has a huge chance to beat Dmitry Bivol.

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: I became a big fan of Bivol after he schooled Canelo, he is a great fighter in his own right, and Ramirez is a respected power puncher but in terms of defense, that's where he lacks Bivol will exploit that weakness, after he beat Canelo there's now a level of invincibility in him, he is a total class fighter we have a saying to be the man you have to beat the man and he schooled the man, so he is the man that will win this matchup, and this has the making of a great fight.

But I have a feeling this would turn out to become a good fight.

comments.author: goinmerry
comments.body: Any shared information on why Dmitry Bivol failed to secure a fight with Artur Beterbiev for the supposed undisputed match at the Light-Heavyweight Division? We know Bivol really wants to chase more titles that's why he shows no interest in the possible rematch with Canelo right away. And now he is ended up in a mandatory title defense which is also a good match providing Zurdo Ramirez is also currently at his peak. That would be a great clash!
